title: How the Lapse in Appropriations affects your visit to Petroglyph
description: The Information Center, Western National Parks Store, and Headquarters will remain closed during the lapse of appropriations period but the petroglyph viewing trails will remain open to the public. Emergency services are limited or unavailable. No trails at Info/Visitor Center. Drive directly to and park at either: Boca Negra Canyon (8:30 am - 4:00 pm), Rinconada Canyon (8:00 am - 5:00 pm), and Piedras Marcadas Canyon (sunrise to sunset). Download and use the NPS App for trail information and maps.

title: White Sands National Park Reopened from October 18 - October 24

The visitor center, Western National Parks store, and White Sands Trading Post will also be open from 9:00 am - 5:00 pm each day. Dunes Drive will be open to the end of the road with the exception of the ongoing Safety Corridor from mile marker 3 - 5.5. Please see the Safety Corridor alert for further details.

title: Water Use Restrictions Are in Place on the South Rim
description: Effective immediately, the South Rim has entered Stage 2 Water Restrictions. Visitors, residents, and park partners are encouraged to continue conserving water by: reporting and repairing leaks promptly; running dishwashers and washing machines only with full loads; taking shorter showers and turning off faucets while brushing teeth or shaving; using reclaimed water for vehicles and landscape maintenance; and reducing toilet flushing in homes, hotels, and public facilities.

title: Patriots Point Ferries Currently Wheelchair Inaccessible
description: Ferries to Fort Sumter from Patriots Point are not currently accessible for individuals who use mobility assistance devices or have trouble navigating stairs. Visitors with these needs should depart from the Fort Sumter Visitor Center at Liberty Square.

title: Val-Kill Cottage Tours
description: Val-Kill cottage will be closed for tours on Mondays, Tuesdays, and Wednesdays this season. The grounds remain open every day according to All Park Hours.

title: Park Store is Cashless
description: The Western National Parks store accepts credit/debit cards and contactless/mobile payments only.

title: Playground in Pine Grove Picnic Area Closed
description: The park is improving accessibility at the playground in Pine Grove Picnic Area. During construction, until approximately the end of December 2025, the playground is closed and 10 nearby parking spaces will be used for construction vehicles only.

title: Scam Warning - Book ferry tickets through concessioner site only
description: Valid ferry tickets can only be purchased through the website www.cumberlandislandferry.com. Check site carefully before purchasing. Only valid tickets will be honored.

title: Fire Restrictions Are In Effect Throughout Zion National Park
description: Fire Restrictions are in effect throughout Zion National Park.

title: Vehicle Length & Trailer Restrictions
description: No large vehicle turnaround after Faraway Ranch Parking (1 mile after entrance). Vehicles over 29 feet park at Faraway. Disconnect trailers at Faraway. Trailers with campground reservations proceed to camp. Scenic drive = 24 ft limit and no trailers.

title: Section of Bush Key is closed
description: A section of Bush Key is closed to support breeding and nesting activities of a colony of Magnificent Frigatebirds. The walk around the island is affected by this closure, however the walk from Garden Key to the tip of Bush Key remains open.

title: Saving America's Treasures Project at Dunbar
description: The Paul Laurence Dunbar House will undergo a major exterior restoration starting 8/18. During that time tours of the historic home will be unavailable. The visitor center will remain open normal hours, and staff on site will lead short talks outdoors.

title: Dunbar House Restoration - Use Caution
description: The Paul Laurence Dunbar House will undergo an exterior restoration starting on 8/18/25. Construction will be focused outside of operating hours, but please use caution on the grounds and observe all construction signage and barriers during the project.

title: Expect Long Waits at the Summit Entrance Station Before Sunset
description: Due to a high volume of traffic, cars may be temporarily turned around at the gate when capacity is reached. Purchasing a pass online does not guarantee entry at sunset. To ensure timely access, arrive 3 hours before sunset.

title: SR 165 Carbon River/Fairfax Bridge is closed: no access to Carbon River or Mowich Lake.
description: There is NO public access to Carbon River & Mowich Lake from SR 165. The bridge is closed to pedestrians, bicycles and vehicles and there is no alternate route.

title: Gauley Tailwaters Campground Closure
description: The Tailwaters Campground in Gauley River National Recreation Area, located below Summersville Dam, will temporarily close from September 2 through September 23 in order to allow for more parking and better river access during the busy Gauley season.

title: No Fruit Available in Orchards
description: Due to an abnormally early spring bloom, followed by a hard freeze, this year's crop was lost. There is no fruit available to pick this year.

title: Fort Barrancas
description: Fort Barrancas is open 9 am–4 pm on the fourth Friday of each month, with last entry to Fort Barrancas at 3:30 pm.

title: Picnic Area Closed Periodically
description: The road up to the picnic area and picnic area may be temporarily closed. Please be careful if going there. Please use caution when hiking near the closed areas. Please report any trees that you find down, and do not climb over or under fallen trees

title: No Pets are allowed on the Cliff Dwelling Trail
description: Pets are not allowed onto the Gila Cliff Dwelling Trail. Kennels are available at the Trailhead on a First Come First Serve basis and are available to those that are going on the Cliff Dwelling Trail not the Wilderness trails.

title: WNP Bookstore closed until further notice
description: The bookstore located at the Trailhead to the Cliff Dwellings will be closed until further notice.

title: Fort Moultrie Fishing Dock Closure
description: The Fort Moultrie Fishing Dock is currently under construction through Spring 2026.

title: Blue Mesa Water Update
description: As of 8/22 cyanotoxin levels were negative/below acceptable State of Colorado public health levels at Iola Basin. Cautionary signs will remain posted around Iola Basin on Blue Mesa Reservoir due to possible future reoccurrence as conditions may change.

title: Alternate Entrance Gate to Mission San José
description: The main visitor entrance to Mission San José compound is closed due to maintenance and repairs. Please follow signs to enter the mission from the Southwest corner gate by Roosevelt Ave. An accessible entrance is available through the church gate.

title: Pardon Our Dust: Chisos Basin Improvement Projects to Begin May 1, 2026
description: Work on two large construction projects in the Chisos Basin will begin in May 2026 and continue for approximately two years. Major disruptions in visitor access to the Chisos Basin are expected during this time. Big Bend National Park will remain OPEN.

title: Park Phone Lines Down Beginning 8/22/25
description: Beginning Friday, August 22 the main park phone line (978-970-5000) and education program line (978-970-5080) will be out of service. If you have questions or request, please email LOWE_Public_Information@nps.gov.

title: No dock access to Rainbow Bridge
description: At current lake levels, Rainbow Bridge docks do not reach the land. Dock-to-trail access to Rainbow Bridge will not be available until water levels rise again. Restrooms at the dock will remain open. Check the link for current lake information.

title: Main Phone Line is Down; Call Temporary Number 631-569-2099
description: Fire Island's main phone number (631-569-2100) is currently experiencing an outage. All callers to the Seashore's general line should call 631-569-2099 to reach the main directory. Dial 911 in an emergency.

title: Tour Road Closed South of Route 36 at the Eastern Front
description: The Tour Road south of Route 36 is closed to vehicles at the Eastern Front. Scheduled maintenance begins. Walkers and bicyclists must follow signs for detours around construction areas.

title: Temporary Visitor Contact Station at Andrew Johnson NHS.
description: On August 23, the Andrew Johnson NHS Visitor Center will be closed for renovations. A temporary visitor contact station is located inside the Memorial Building adjacent to the visitor center. Renovation work is expected to take approximately 6 months.

title: Perimeter Trail Closed
description: The section of the perimeter trail from the .8 mile marker to the 1.9 mile marker at Park Central Road is closed for repairs. This trail was closed under emergency conditions on July 22, 2025, and will remain closed until December 31, 2025, at 11:59 p.m.

title: Hosmer Grove Water Fountain
description: As of August 15, 2025, the water fountain at Hosmer Grove is offline. There is potable water available at the spigots in the campground area.

title: For Visitor information or assistance, Call (334) 727-1247
description: For visitor information or assistance at Tuskegee Airmen National Historic Site, please call (334) 727-1247.

title: Harmful Algae Blooms Spotted on the Shoreline of Lake Mohave
description: Avoid swimming where bright green algae is floating on the water. Keep pets away from the water. For more information and photos click the ‘more’ link.

title: Bag Policy
description: Bags larger than 9"x11"x5" and all backpacks are not permitted in the historic homes. The park does not have storage lockers for these items. Bags may not be left unattended. Anyone carrying a bag larger than 9"x11"x5" or a backpack will not be admitted.

title: Park Store To Go Cashless
description: Starting August 14th, 2025 the park store will go cashless. All major credit cards, debit cards and mobile electronic payments will be accepted.

title: Do Not Approach Wildlife - Rabies
description: A raccoon found near the Smithfield Beach commercial launch tested positive for rabies. Out of an abundance of caution, all visitors should keep a safe distance from and avoid approaching any wildlife. Call 1-800-543-4295 if you need immediate assistance.

title: Fort Pulaski Demilune Temporarily Closed
description: Due to temporary standing water, Fort Pulaski's Demilune is closed until further notice. Park staff will reopen the area after assessments and mitigations are completed.

title: Great Allegheny Passage Closure between Rockwood and Markleton, Pennsylvania
description: Somerset County has closed a segment of the Great Allegheny Passage between Rockwood (mile marker 43.8) and the parking lot at Markleton (mile marker 50.0) due to an active landslide triggered by recent heavy rain and high winds. Conditions are unstable.

title: Great Allegheny Passage Erosion Near Confluence, Pennsylvania (Mile Marker 56)
description: Heavy rain & flash floods on June 8 eroded a section of trail along the Great Allegheny Passage between Rockwood and Confluence. Crews from Somerset County have placed caution tape for awareness. The GAP remains open at that location; please be cautious.

title: Pay fees by credit/debit card only.
description: Only credit or debit cards accepted for cave tours and campground fees. Oregon Caves National Monument and Preserve entrance is free, but cave access requires a guided tour.

title: Technical Difficulties with Phones
description: Oregon Caves phone system is down. For general park info, please call the Illinois Valley Visitor Center at 541-592-5125. Thank you for your patience and understanding.

title: Trail CLOSED Between Visitor Center and Montville Trailhead
description: The access train that leads from the visitor center to the Montville and Mosca Pass Trails is CLOSED due to construction. Hikers may start at the Montville Trail parking lot. Visitor Center access remains open.

title: Trail Restrooms Closed
description: Restrooms located at the North intersection of Old Carriage Road Trail and Matildaville Trail are closed due a water leak. There are portable toilets available at this location. Restrooms located at the Visitor Center are open between 9-5.

title: Limited Amphitheater Accessibility
description: Construction vehicles are operating through the parking lot & Lower Overlook Park - use caution & be vigilant for hazards. Lower Overlook & Amphitheater access is via stairs only for construction duration.

title: No Water in the Hōlua Area
description: As of August 8, 2025, there is NO water in the Hōlua area (Patrol and Visitor Cabins). This is the result of an extremely dry summer season. All backcountry travelers should plan to pack in all needed water when traveling through the Hōlua Area.

title: North Abutment Overlook Closure
description: The North Abutment deck leading to the overlook is in the process of being replaced. There is no visitor access to the North Abutment overlook until construction is complete.

title: Black Bear near northern boundary
description: This summer, a young black bear near the northern boundary of Yukon-Charley damaged tents and followed campers despite noise and a dog. No food was taken. Use extreme caution and follow bear safety measures in this area.

title: Campground Closures
description: The following campgrounds are closed pending repairs: Pulltite (sites 1-13) and Dee Murray. Day use areas remain open for visitors.

title: Limited Seating and No Restrooms
description: Rehabilition work has begun on the memorial plaza. During this time, there will be no access to the restrooms at the memorial. Also, construction fencing at the memorial limits seating. Restrooms and seating areas are be available at the Visitor Center.

title: Upper and Lower Plaza Rehabilitation
description: Fencing has been put up for assessment work and will limit visitor access to the upper plaza; however, access to the column, rotunda, and observation deck will be maintained. Worker safety and resource protection are key. Thank you for your understanding.

title: Expect Long Lines at Island in the Sky Entrance
description: Between March and November, particularly on busy holiday weekends, you may experience long lines at the entrance road. Parking lots at popular trailheads and viewpoints will fill early. Pack your patience and arrive early to avoid crowds.

title: Difficult Conditions Complicate Cataract Canyon Takeouts
description: Hite Ramp is closed. The North Wash take-out is a primitive, unimproved dirt take-out. You will not be able to back a trailer down the dirt slope. Recent washouts have further deteriorated conditions.

title: Partial Reopening: Cross Estate Gardens
description: The Cross Estate gardens have reopened as of August 4. However, a portion of the trellis area remains closed due to storm damage and ongoing safety concerns. Please do not enter the roped-off section until repairs are complete.

title: Picnic grove restrooms
description: The restrooms at the picnic groves throughout the park are currently closed. Portable comfort stations with handwashing stations are in place until they reopen.

title: Chatham Closed for Rehabilitation Project
description: Chatham's interior will be closed until at least summer 2026 for a major rehabilitation project. The grounds remain open sunrise to sunset, and the gated parking area will be open from 9-5 daily.

title: Paving on Crater Road (Route 378)
description: Paving has begun on the road to the Summit District. Work will be done in sections between Mile Post 0 in Kula and Haleakalā entrance through October. Expect delays and leave extra time Monday through Friday, 8 a.m. to 5 p.m.

title: WNP Bookstore is Cashless
description: The Western National Parks (WNP) bookstore has moved to a cashless operation at Timpanogos Cave National Monument. Purchases can be made with credit and debit cards as well as contactless payment methods including Google Pay, Apple Pay, and Samsung Pay.

title: Painted Desert Visitor Center Temporary Closure and Relocation
description: In anticipation of a major construction project the Painted Desert Visitor Center on the north side of park will be closed starting 7/23/25. Visitor center operations will be located at the Painted Desert Inn, two miles past the entrance station.

title: Park Bookstore Going Cashless on Tuesday, August 5, 2025
description: We are excited to announce that our park store, operated by Western National Parks, will begin operating on a cashless basis on Tuesday, August 5, 2025. For your convenience, they accept all major credit and debit cards, as well as mobile payment options.

title: Opal Beach Pavilion Restroom Operating Hours
description: The new temporary operating hours for Opal Beach Complex Restrooms: Monday through Thursday, only pavilion A, B2, and E restrooms will be open. On Friday, Saturday, and Sunday, all pavilion restrooms except C will be open.

title: William Johnson House Reopens!
description: The first floor exhibit hall of the William Johnson House is now open to the public daily from 8:30 am to 5:00 pm. Due to construction, the second floor family living quarters remain closed at this time.

title: Peavine Road Closed
description: Peavine Road near Big Spring will be closed for paving beginning 7/28 at noon and will remain closed for several weeks. Please use Highway 103 to reach all destinations in the Big Spring area.

title: Road workers on Park Road in Davis Bayou
description: Phase II of the Davis Bayou Bicycle and Pedestrian Path and road resurfacing project has begun. Visitors may encounter minor traffic delays and flaggers on Park Road.

title: Parking at Boundary Access Areas
description: Visitors are reminded to park in designated parking areas when accessing the park via boundary trailheads. Parking in unauthorized locations may result in your vehicle being towed at the owner's expense.

title: Fire Ban in Effect: No Charcoal or Firewood Fires Permitted
description: San Juan County Fire Danger has been upgraded to VERY HIGH. No charcoal or firewood fires are allowed. This includes the designated fire rings at South Beach. Propane fireplaces and pellet BBQ grills are allowed.

title: Delays on Bryce Point Road Possible - Take the Free Shuttle!
description: Short traffic delays may occur on the road to Bryce Point due to construction on the Share-Use Path. Visitors should watch for flaggers in the area. Consider using the park shuttle (free with park admission) to minimize traffic congestion.

title: Phone Lines Down
description: Chamizal National Memorial is experiencing temporary phone outages. We apologize for the inconvenience. Information regarding our hours of operation can be found under Plan Your Visit and questions can be directed to cham_information@nps.gov.

title: Temporary Location - Selma Welcome Center
description: Due to the closure of the Selma Interpretive Center, the Selma Welcome Center at 14 Broad Street has trail staff to provide visitor information services.

title: Bridge Closure on Sunflower Road
description: Sunflower Road is closed at Big Sandy Creek for bridge replacement. Big Sandy Trail is open and accessible via Sunflower Road from Dallardsville.

title: Ongoing Road Repair on Main Road
description: Ongoing road work will be taking place throughout the Main Road on the island. Expect potentially heavier vehicle traffic and areas of uneven terrain. Please yield to construction traffic.

title: Heat Advisory
description: Heat illnesses can occur on the hiking trail. Always carry and drink plenty of water—at least 1 liter. Dehydration and heat illness can happen quickly, even on short hikes. Be prepared.

title: Tickets are required to enter Timpanogos Cave
description: Reservations are strongly recommended. Reservations are the only way to ensure a spot is available for your party. Please plan accordingly by visiting Recreation.gov to secure your tickets in advance. Availability of walk-up tickets is not guaranteed.

title: Park Wide Caution
description: Visitors should exercise caution when hiking areas of the park that have opened since Hurricane Helene. Hazards on trails and in forested areas such as hanging tree limbs, debris on the ground, and washed-out sections of trails and bridges are possible.

title: Phone Lines Down
description: Our phone lines are being upgraded and are currently down. If you need to contact us please email: NISI_Information@nps.gov Or you may call Cowpens National Battlefield at: 864 461-2828

title: Extended Mt. Auburn Street and Sparks Street Closure
description: Local road closures and detours on Mount Auburn Street and Sparks Street, and a lane closure on Memorial Drive, may affect traffic and directions to the site. Please observe posted detour and traffic change signs.

title: Backcountry Trail Conditions
description: GPS is necessary on backcountry trails: Oakridge, River, and Kingsnake. These trails may be difficult to follow.

title: Temporary Visitor Center open 9am to 5pm daily
description: To complete an interior renovation construction project, the Visitor Center has been temporarily moved to the opposite end of the Visitor Center parking lot. The temporary Visitor Center is in a wheelchair accessible trailer.

title: Construction Vehicles on Scenic Drive
description: On a section of Scenic Drive near Cabin Camp 3, a culvert under the road was recently replaced. Use caution and follow posted speed limits. Be aware of construction vehicles on the roadway in this area.

title: Steel Creek Ranger Station Closed
description: The Steel Creek Ranger Station is closed. Please call Tyler Bend Visitor Center at 870-439-2502 for information about the park's Upper District.

title: Drewry's Bluff Parking Update
description: Parking lot at the Drewry’s Bluff unit is currently open and accessible to vehicles from 9:30 am to 4:30 pm. Reminder: ATVs, dirtbikes, and bicycles are prohibited on park trails. Foot traffic only is permitted beyond the parking area.

title: Ohanapecosh Campground area closed for construction in 2025.
description: The entire Ohanapecosh Campground area is CLOSED for the duration of the construction project, including all campsites, visitor center, restrooms, picnic area, & Ohanapecosh river access.

title: Portion of the boardwalk is closed
description: The last section of boardwalk is closed for ADA accessibility. Sorry for the inconvenience.

title: Phone System Outage
description: The phone systems at New Bedford Whaling National Historical Park are currently down. We apologize for the inconvenience and appreciate your patience as we work to resolve the issue. For assistance, please contact us by email at nebe_info@nps.gov.

title: Heat Advisory
description: Stay hydrated, wear light clothing, and avoid outdoor activity during peak heat. Never leave children or pets in cars. Watch for signs of heat illness like cramps, exhaustion, or stroke. Plan visits during cooler hours when possible.

title: Shenandoah National Park Moves to Fully Cashless Fee Collection July 1
description: On July 1, 2025, the park transitioned to a fully cashless system at our fee entrance stations. Only credit cards, debit cards, or mobile payments will be accepted.

title: Swimmer's Itch Reported at Brandy Creek Beach
description: We have received an usually high number of reports of Swimmer's Itch from visitors at Brandy Creek Beach this year. Learn more about Swimmer's Itch and how to prevent it

title: Boardwalk Partially Closed for Construction
description: The lower section of the boardwalk loop is closed for construction at this time, and the Weston Lake Overlook is now open. Please click "more" below for a map highlighting the closed section and alternate routes.

title: Green River Ferry Temporarily Closed
description: The Green River Ferry is temporarily closed for several months while repairs are made to its navigational system and support towers which sustained extensive damage during flooding in April 2025.

title: 7/07/2025 - Single Lane Closures from MP 354.3-363.7
description: Single lane closures will occur in Wayne County, TN from mileposts 354.3 to 363.7. Flaggers will be on the roadways to help direct traffic.

title: Saint-Gaudens NHP is cashless
description: Cash payments at Saint-Gaudens NHP are not accepted as a method of payment for entry passes. Credit and debit cards are accepted.

title: Experiencing High Temperatures in the Visitor Center
description: While planning your visit to the site please note that we are currently experiencing some high temperatures in the Visitor Center. We apologize for any inconvenience this may cause as we work to alleviate the issue.

title: Expect large crowds and high traffic volume on weekends
description: Big crowds and high traffic volume may cause the main parking lot on Shoreline Drive to fill and close for short periods of time. Check park social media channels for the latest updates.

title: Fire restrictions in place
description: Fire restrictions are in place at Mojave National Preserve and Castle Mountains National Monument. Wood and charcoal fires are not permitted. Most camp stoves are. See fire restriction order for additional restrictions and details.

title: Old NC 284 is closed from Cataloochee Creek to Cataloochee Valley
description: Old NC 284 is open from Big Creek to Cataloochee creek, however there is no access to Cataloochee Valley due to road damage.
relatedRoadEvents: [{'title': 'Old 284 closed to all traffic near Cataloochee', 'id': 'C7DB457F-58CA-4C25-B7F4-17FA3FF53AD1', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/grsm/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}]

title: Trail Maintenance Work on Fatlands and Chapel Trails in 2025
description: Ongoing maintenance work on Fatland Trail (formerly River Trail) between Betzwood and parking lot on Pawlings Rd and on Chapel Trail west of Chapel, taking place in 2025. Trails remain open. Trail users should use extra caution and follow safety warnings

title: Click on "view all alerts" below for important details on accessing the park
description: Construction on Tamiami Trail may cause minor delays. If you have a scheduled tour, please plan accordingly. View all alerts for more updates on current conditions in the park.

title: Boca Chita Historic District
description: Work on the Boca Chita Lighthouse began Monday 01/20/2025 and is ongoing.  During this project the interior of this iconic lighthouse will be closed to the public.  Updates will be provided when available.

title: No Recreational Vehicle (RV) Parking
description: Our parking lot cannot accommodate RVs or trailers. Check out our FAQs page or follow the link for a map to a nearby lot for parking and trailers to detach. RVs should NOT pull into the parking lot.

title: Elevated Fire Risks - Full Closure (Vehicle and Foot Traffic) in Prone Areas
description: Drought conditions pose risk of fire. The following areas are closed to vehicle and foot traffic until further notice: Coastal Road between lighthouse and Boom Site/Kalawao cattleguards; settlement perimeter road along fence, roads through fuel farm.

title: Stage 2 Fire Restrictions
description: Igniting or using fires fueled by combustible materials, that create an open flame, is strictly prohibited. Smoking is only allowed within an enclosed vehicle or developed site.

title: Stage 2 Fire Restrictions
description: Igniting or using fires fueled by combustible materials, that create an open flame, is strictly prohibited. Smoking is only allowed within an enclosed vehicle or developed site.

title: Arlington House Periodic Closings
description: Arlington House may be periodically closed due to a broken HVAC system and excessive heat. Park staff will monitor temperatures in the house and enact temporary closures as needed to ensure visitor safety.

title: Phone lines working intermittently
description: Our phone lines are working intermittently. If you are not able to reach us by phone, please email us at bela_information@nps.gov.

title: Vehicle Entrance Reservation Not Needed
description: Although an entrance pass is required to enter Yellowstone National Park, vehicle reservations are not needed. You are encouraged to purchase an entrance pass before arriving, but you may also purchase passes at any entrance station upon arrival.

title: Kaymoor Miner's Trail Partial Closure
description: NPS crews are working to improve safety and sustainability of the upper section of the Kaymoor Miner's Trail. The upper portion of the trail will be closed from June 30 thru November 14 on Mondays through Thursday from Kaymoor Top the top of the stairs.

title: Straight Fork and the one-way section of Balsam Mountain Road closed.
description: Straight Fork and the one-way section of Balsam Mountain Road (Heintooga Round-Bottom Road) are closed. The 9-mile paved section of Balsam Mountain Road remains open; visitors may still access Balsam Mountain Campground.

title: Raccoons Within Federally-managed Areas Observed Exhibiting Distemper Symptoms
description: Visitors are advised to avoid potential human and pet encounters with wildlife including raccoons. Raccoons with Canine Distemper Virus may appear lethargic or disoriented. CDV cannot be transmitted to humans, but can be transmitted to unvaccinated dogs.

title: Sherrick Farm Trail Detour
description: There is a detour on the trail due to downed trees. Our staff is working diligently to remove these from the trail.

title: Closure of Marquette Trail
description: The Marquette Trail from the Paul H. Douglas Center to West Beach is closed March 19 through the year's end for a paving project. There will be no public access during this time. The Paul H. Douglas Trail (Miller Woods Trail) remains open.

title: 2025 RANGER III Parking Area Construction Notice: Carpool When Possible
description: Houghton city will be doing construction work that affects the upper, non-gated lot for most of the 2025 summer season. Parking may become limited in the NPS available lots. To help with available parking, when possible, please carpool.

title: Charging Stations are Currently Unavailable
description: The charging stations at Skyland are currently out of service.

title: Fire Restrictions in Place
description: Stage 1 Fire Restrictions are in effect. Wood and charcoal fires are prohibited at all low-elevation campgrounds and picnic areas. Additional restrictions apply. Click "more" for details.

title: Use Caution with "Fossil Beds Information" Signs
description: The new visitor center is located at 17970 US Hwy 30, about one mile north of downtown Hagerman and the old visitor center. Highway signs are not up-to-date.

title: Biscuit Basin Closed Due to Hydrothermal Explosion
description: The parking lot, boardwalk, and Firehole River at Biscuit Basin, located north of Old Faithful, is closed to all travel until further notice due to the possibility of another event at the site of a hydrothermal explosion that occurred July 23, 2024.

title: Sidewalk closure
description: Beginning on Monday June 9th the Pedestrian walkway and ramp on the Southeast corner of Pine Street and Nassau will be closed because of utility work. There will be a temporary crosswalk. The entrance to Federal Hall will still be at 15 Pine Street.

title: Don't Move a Mussel!
description: Hey Boaters, please clean, drain, and dry your vessel completely before setting out on Whiskeytown Lake. Thank you for doing your part to keep the Golden Mussel, an aquatic invasive species, out of the reservoir. Learn more about preventative measures.

title: Lakina River Update
description: A recently observed landslide across the Lakina River is creating a debris hazard on a popular packrafting route. The river water is cutting its way through, but is highly dynamic and should be expected to remain that way through the boating season.

title: Mount Locust Visitor Contact Station and Grounds Open Wednesday-Sunday
description: Mount Locust Visitor Contact Station is now open. The contact station and grounds are open Wednesday through Sunday. The historic inn/stand is closed indefinitely due to serious structural concerns. You can still view the inn/stand but cannot enter.

title: Belmont-Paul Women's Equality NM exterior lift
description: The exterior lift from Second Street to the entrance level is not fully functional. We apologize for the inconvenience. Contact us at bepa_info@nps.gov for more information.

title: No House Tours on Tuesdays and Wednesdays
description: During the 2025 visitor season, Martin Van Buren’s historic home, Lindenwald, is closed to the public on Tuesdays and Wednesdays. Guided house tours are available Thursday through Monday. The park grounds and Visitor Center remain open seven days a week.

title: Devil's Island Marina Construction
description: Contractors will be rehabbing the Devils Island Marina during summer 2025. During this time, the marina and campsite will remain closed. Staging for this project may cause occasional impacts at Little Sand Bay.

title: Cashless Operations
description: Black Canyon's operations are now cashless. South Rim Campground is by reservation only via Recreation.gov. East Portal & North Rim campgrounds accept payment for first-come first-served sites ONLY using Scan & Pay through Recreation.gov's mobile app.

title: Selma Interpretive Center Closed for Major Construction
description: The Selma Interpretive Center will remain closed to the public until the project’s completion, which is expected by 2028. The Lowndes and Montgomery Interpretive Centers and the temporary location at the Selma Welcome Center at 14 Broad Street are open

title: Mainland Parking Lot Closure June 2
description: The mainland parking lot will be closed as of June 2 for rehab and improvements. For more information please see the press release.

title: Elevator Offline in the Taft Home
description: The elevator in the Taft home is offline. As of now, we do not have a timeline for the repairs to be completed. The Taft Education Center remains accessible.

title: Auto-Theft Warning - Only Bring What You Need to the Park
description: You can prevent vehicle break-ins in parking lots and scenic overlooks. Before leaving your car for even a short period of time: 1) Remove all valuables, 2) Lock your doors. 3) Take your cell phones and electronics with you. Read article for more details.

title: Summer season operations change
description: Beginning, Sat, May 24, 2025, we will start a summer schedule. Forts will be open 10am to 5pm, Wed thru Sun. For safety, the Fort Jay front gate will be closed on days with winds of 35 mph sustained or gusts of 50mph, or higher.

title: No Potable Water in Park Campgrounds
description: There currently is no water available in any campground in Great Basin National Park.  Water is available at the Lehman Caves Visitor Center, Park Dump Station, Great Basin Visitor Center, and local businesses.

title: Acadian Cultural Center Temporarily Closed
description: The Acadian Cultural Center in Lafayette is temporarily closed due to air conditioning issues. Join us at the Prairie Acadian Cultural Center in Eunice for programs and events 5 days a week, Tuesday through Saturday.

title: Visitor Center Alert
description: Visitor Center open ONLY Sunday and Monday 8:30am-4:00pm. Outdoor amenities (bathrooms, passport stamp station, drinking fountain) and grounds remain OPEN DAILY from sunrise to sunset.

title: Water Outage at Ponderosa Campground
description: The Ponderosa Campground is experiencing a temporary water outage. Please bring all the water you’ll need for your visit, including drinking water.

title: Possible Bridge Closure
description: The Circle Trail bridge under Winnewissa Falls may be closed temporarily due to flooding caused by spring rain. Please pay attention to signage posted in the Visitor Center and at the bridge. The rest of the park and Circle Trail remain open.

title: Meyers Beach Parking Fees: Digital Payments Only
description: All parking fees at Meyers Beach must be paid online through pay.gov. Look for on-site signage with QR codes directing to the payment form. Cash will not be accepted on-site. This change follows the March 25, 2025 Executive Order on modernizing payments.

title: Contact Us
description: We continue to experience issues with our phone lines, please contact us via our email address: boha_information@nps.gov

title: Restroom Closures at Greenbelt Park
description: Restrooms at the Laurel and Holly Picnic Areas will be closed April 15–November 15, 2025, and remain closed afterward per the Superintendent’s Compendium schedule.

title: Picnic Area Closure at Fort Washington Park
description: The D1 Picnic Area will be closed April 15–November 15, 2025, and remain closed afterward per the Superintendent’s Compendium schedule.

title: Picnic and Restroom Closures at Fort Dupont Park
description: The Ridge Road Picnic Area and restrooms, along with the Lanham Estates restrooms, will be closed April 15–November 15, 2025, and remain closed afterward per the Superintendent’s Compendium schedule.

title: Restroom Closures at Anacostia Park
description: Restrooms near the Pirate Ship Playground and Aquatic Resources Education Center will be closed April 15–November 15, 2025, and remain closed afterward per the Superintendent’s Compendium schedule.

title: Anchoring Permit Not Required
description: Anchoring is allowed without a permit in the designated location on the west side of Buck Island. Updated permitting procedures will be announced at a later date. Check back for updates.

title: Tour Road Closed
description: Due to safety hazards caused by tornado damage, the Tour Road is open up to Tour Stop 2, but no further, and the Nature Trail is closed. The Visitor Center is now open.

title: Stehekin Flash Flood and Debris Flow Area
description: The Stehekin area is prone to flooding, which increases in a post-fire environment. Know before you go – visit the Post Fire Safety page for information on what to do in a flash flood and debris flow area

title: Major Road Closure in Corinth, MS
description: ALERT - Major Road Closure in Corinth, Mississippi. A major bridge replacement has begun on North Polk Street in Corinth, MS, and motorists will need to seek other routes. The work is not estimated to be completed until July or August 2026.

title: Ongoing Window Replacement Project in Visitor Center
description: A project is ongoing to replace leaky windows to in the park visitor center. The visitor center remains open. Flow through the visitor center may be altered and visitors may experience loud noise associated with construction work.

title: Possible Delays on Old Mine Road due to Van Campens bridge repairs
description: Due to a bridge repair project over the Van Campens Brook, visitors on Old Mine Road may encounter delays over Summer 2025. The road will remain open, with single-lane traffic during working hours.

title: Main Street Walpack Bridge Closed Until Further Notice
description: Main Street in Walpack Center is closed at the Flatbrook Bridge due to structural damage to the bridge.

title: Parking Lot Closure
description: Due to ongoing construction, the parking lot is closed. Ample street parking can be found along Dudley Street, including the Brookline Reservoir. For accessible parking, please visit our "Contact Us" page for more information.

title: Restrooms at Thompson Boat Center
description: The indoor restrooms of Thompson Boat Center continue to be closed due to repairs needed to a sewage line. Temporary restrooms with hand sanitizer remain available near the building and will be in place until the indoor restrooms reopen.

title: New Campground Schedule for 2025
description: Buckhorn Campground Loops A and B and Rock Creek Campground will only be open on holiday weekends (Memorial, 4th of July, Labor Day) during the summer season.

title: Condition of Turkey Creek Trail
description: Turkey Creek Trail, located near the Harbor Bay Campground Area, is available to hike for one-mile at this time. The trail past one-mile is underwater.

title: Off Road Vehicle Inspections
description: ORV renewals & new permits will be issued at the Nathanial P. Reed Visitor Center Friday-Monday, 9am-1:30pm. No permits will be issued Tuesday-Thursday. Permits will be issued first-come first-served. Visit our ORV page for more information

title: Temporary Closure of Select Trails for Rehabilitation Project
description: The Old Guides Trail, Heritage Trail, Sunset Point Trail and areas of the Sinkhole Trail are currently closed due to a trail rehabilitation project.

title: If You Can't Reach Us By Phone, Please Email Us
description: Please call 208-933-4105 to talk to a park ranger. However, if the phone lines are down, contact a ranger through email at hafo_information@nps.gov

title: Construction
description: There is ongoing construction due to roofing project. Please practice caution on the grounds and do not enter marked areas.

title: Truman Farm Home Closed, Grounds Remain Open
description: Due to ongoing foundation construction, the park is suspending Truman Farm Home tours. The grounds are open from sunrise to sunset. Audio tours are available through the NPS App.

title: Kīlauea eruption
description: Volcanic activity is episodic, with eruptions separated by pauses lasting several days or more. Eruption can be as short as a few hours. Check webcams and USGS volcano update for current conditions before visiting. Stay safe and follow all regulations.

title: Reminder: Look Before Parking
description: Visitors are reminded to park in marked parking spaces. Parking in the grass or other alternative areas is unauthorized. Please help us #KeepFortMonroeBeautiful.

title: Road Closure and Fishing Pier Impact
description: The Engineer Wharf, one of two fishing piers at Fort Monroe is temporarily closed. The Finger Pier remains open. Also closed is the section of Fenwick Road between Ingalls and the East Gate of the fort. Detour signs will aid travelers around the closure.

title: North Manitou Island village and dock are closed for the 2025 season
description: The North Manitou Island village and dock are closed for the 2025 season due to construction of a new dock. The island remains open for camping via access by private boat and CUA holders.

title: Roads May Be Icy - Please Use Caution!
description: Even though the sun is shining, the open roads in the park may still have icy patches, especially in the mornings and evenings when the temperatures drop. Please drive with caution.

title: Munising Falls Trail Closed Until Further Notice
description: The Munising Falls Trail within Pictured Rocks National Lakeshore is closed until further notice. Approximately 75-feet of the paved trail was washed out April 28th from recent heavy rainfall and seasonal snow melt.

title: Canyon from Toe of Exit Glacier to the Outwash Plain
description: The canyon from the toe of Exit Glacier to where Exit Creek opens into the Outwash Plain is susceptible to sudden outburst flood events. These events produce sudden surges of water, ice and rock. For your safety please stick to designated park trails.

title: For Current Visitor Information
description: For the most up to date information on Frances Perkins National Monument, please visit the website for the Frances Perkins Center at francesperkinscenter.org.

title: Rabies potential in and around the park
description: Incidents of rabies are on the rise across Arizona. Beware of your surroundings & take caution when out with pets. Report unusual wildlife behavior to park staff. All pets must be on leash and on pet friendly trails while in the park.

title: Butterfield Trail closed to horses and pack animals.
description: The trail remains open for hiking and foot traffic. For more information, see our policy page.

title: Pulltite Campground Partial Closure
description: Sites 1-13 remain closed. All other sites are open. Sites are available by reservation only - book online at https://www.recreation.gov/camping/campgrounds/234357

title: Davis Bayou Visitor Center
description: The William M. Colmer visitor center will be open Wednesday through Sunday from 9 a.m. to 4 p.m.

title: Fort Matanzas Only Accessible by Ferry Service
description: Fort Matanzas may only be accessed by our free ferry service. The boats operate Thursday through Monday; we do not operate the ferry on Tuesdays or Wednesdays. For more information about tickets and times, please visit the "Plan Your Visit" tab.

title: River Trail periodically closed under I-16
description: The section of the River Trail beneath Interstate 16 is closed during bridge construction when pedestrian safety is at risk and remains open when no significant hazards are present.

title: Visitor Center and Bookstore Open Thurs - Sun
description: Visitor Center and Bookstore hours are Thurs - Sun 10-4. It is .5 mile walk to the historic area from the Hikers Lot. Please keep this in mind. If you have access needs, please call the number posted in the parking lot.

title: Ongoing Construction at the Emmett Till Interpretive Center
description: Due to ongoing construction, access to some areas of the Emmett Till Interpretive Center will be limited through May 5, 2025.

title: No potable water at Pinnacle
description: No potable water is available at the Pinnacle.

title: Reservations Required for Developed Campgrounds
description: As of January 1, 2025, ALL developed campsites will be available through reservation ONLY. These include Pulltite, Round Spring, Alley Spring, Big Spring, Two Rivers, and Akers. Reservations must be made through recreation.gov (online or by calling).

title: Change to Travertine Nature Center Schedule
description: Beginning April 22, 2025, the Travertine Nature Center, located across from Little Niagara, will be closed on Tuesdays and Wednesdays until further notice.

title: Diablo East Marina Cove, Scuba Cove, and Walkway Access Are Closed
description: The Diablo East Marina Cove, Scuba Cove, and walkway access are closed because of the presence of excessive docking material, unsafe walkway and dock, and unstable, loose ground. The area will reopen once these hazards have been corrected.

title: Fort Bowie Visitor Center Bookstore is now cashless!
description: For your convenience, we accept all major credit and debit cards, as well as mobile payment options. Electronic payment reduces transaction times, save money, and improves accountability. Thank you for your understanding and continued support!

title: Temporary Exhibit Closures:
description: The museum remains open as work progresses to redesign/refurbish exhibit spaces within. Click on the "more >" link below to see which exhibits are currently affected.

title: Talisman-Barrett Beach Dock Closed Due to Ice Damage; Reduced Services for Summer Season
description: Due to damage from winter ice, the Talisman-Barrett Beach dock is closed to all public use until further notice. No lifeguards will be present during the summer season. Visitors should pack out trash and expect reduced restroom services.

title: Select restrooms
description: As of April 2, 2025, select restrooms are closed until further notice.

title: We cannot mail out at this time
description: We cannot mail out at this time. This includes but is not limited to JR badges, books, brochures, and park stamps. Our apologies for any inconvenience. Click the link to download Junior Ranger books.

title: Gulf Coast Visitor Center - under construction
description: The new Marjory Stoneman Douglas Visitor Center and surrounding site are under construction until Fall 2025. Park Rangers can be found in the Everglades Adventures Visitor Center located at 611 Collier Ave in Everglades City. (786) 758-0635

title: We cannot mail out at this time
description: We cannot mail out at this time. This includes but is not limited to JR badges, books, brochures, and park stamps. Our apologies for any inconvenience. You may, however, download a map by clicking the link below

title: North Union Avenue and Grant Circle Closed for Repairs
description: North Union Avenue and Grant Circle are closed to vehicular and pedestrian traffic for repairs. Entering these construction areas is prohibited. This work is to repair severe weather damage in 2020. The remainder of the park and tour road are open.

title: Ongoing work on Lower Town buildings
description: Facilities staff are doing repair work on several buildings in Lower Town. Please follow signs for alternate entrances and heed temporary closures.

title: We cannot mail out at this time
description: We cannot mail out at this time. This includes but is not limited to JR badges, books, brochures, and park stamps. Our apologies for any inconvenience

title: Artifacts Removed From Museum
description: Due to leaks and humidity issues, most of the historic artifacts have been taken off exhibit to protect them until these issues have been resolved. Exhibit area is still open including text panels, maps, and hands-on-exhibits.

title: Secure trash and food
description: Pack it in, pack it out! There are no trash services in or around the monument. All food & trash must be secured inside a vehicle. Ravens routinely open zipped bags & tear into trash bags left outside or in the bed of a truck.

title: Park Operating Hours
description: Operating hours are 9:00 am to 3:30 pm Wednesday through Sunday until further notice.

title: New Phone Number: 540-490-9569
description: The new phone number for visitor information is 540-490-9569. The former number no longer works but may still be listed in some places.

title: Scan & Pay Required for Backcountry Campgrounds
description: Starting April 15, 2025, "backcountry" campgrounds will only accept payment through Scan & Pay, on the recreation.gov mobile app. While the app works offline, visitors should download the app and set up their account beforehand. Cell service is limited.

title: South Unit temporarily closed south of Grand Teton Drive; Trailheads remain open.
description: The South Unit of Tule Springs Fossil Beds is temporarily closed to visitor access south of Grand Teton Drive, between Tule Springs Parkway and North Fifth Street in North Las Vegas for visitor safety during construction activities.

title: Costly Outcome: Shark Island
description: Located near the Point of Cape Lookout, a sandbar has begun to connect, known as Shark Island, which lies outside of Cape Lookout's jurisdiction. The sand in this region is soft, making it difficult to navigate, increasing the risk of becoming stuck.

title: Melrose Mansion Guided Tours
description: Reservations for guided tours of the mansion must be made on Recreation.gov. The tour is $11.00 and are at 10, 11, 2, 3, and 4; masks are optional. The estate is open daily from 8:30 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. The grounds and outbuildings are free.

title: Road Damage
description: Due to damage from heavy rains, some roads may require high clearance or 4x4 vehicles for passage. Please use caution when approaching and driving on roadways. Trailers over 30 feet not advised.

title: Cold Springs Men's Restroom Closed For Repairs
description: The men's restroom between campsites 15 and 17 in Cold Springs is closed for repairs. The women's side remains open. The nearest available men's restroom is located across from campsite 5.

title: Northwest Perimeter Road Open
description: Northwest Perimeter Road is now accessible to visitors. Extensive cleanup and restoration efforts have been made following the EF 3 tornado that occurred on 4/27/2024. Please exercise good judgment and caution when driving or hiking through this area.

title: Hyde Street Pier Closure
description: Hyde Street Pier and access to historic ships will be closed to public until further notice starting 11/04/2024 in preparation for Hyde Street Pier renovation work.

title: Rose Farm Rehabilitation Project Closure Notice
description: As of May 2023, the Rose Farm & Rose Lane are closed to all visitation. The house will undergo a full rehabilitation. This work prohibits the use of the area around the house and lane during construction. Worker safety and resource protection are key.

title: David Wills House Closure
description: The David Wills House closed in October 2024 due to a burst water line and will remain closed for the remainder of 2025. No known reopening date is available. Please visit our David Wills House web page for more information and a 3D tour of the house.

title: Voicemail Unavailable on main Park Line
description: Voicemail on the main park line is currently unavailable. Please use the contact function at the bottom of this page, and we will respond as quickly as possible.

title: Preservation Work Along Trails
description: Starting March 18, preservationists restoring the bronze state plaques along the entrance road, and the War of 1812 commemorative markers in the Orpheus Grove. Some of these areas may be temporarily closed while work is in progress.

title: Glover Archbold Trail detour
description: For visitor safety, the southern end of the Glover Archbold Trail is under an emergency closure until further notice due to aerial hazards. Please follow the posted detour along Foxhall Rd. / 44th St. NW / P St. NW.

title: For entrance fees, we accept digital passes and credit/debit cards
description: Digital passes or credit/debit cards are the ONLY method of payment at all fee collection areas. Pre-paid digital passes are available online and may be purchased in advance.

title: Pa-Hay-Okee Overlook Trail closed for replacement project until Fall 2025
description: The Pa-Hay-Okee boardwalk trail, tower and parking lot will be closed for a replacement project until the fall. This is to replace aging infrastructure. The road remains open as a turnaround.

title: Park Wide Caution
description: Visitors should exercise caution when hiking areas of the park that have opened since Hurricane Helene. Hazards on trails and in forested areas such as hanging tree limbs, debris on the ground, and washed-out sections of trails and bridges are possible.

title: Phone Issues/Alternate Contact - 3/12/2025
description: Our landline is currently down, and all calls to the site 's main phone number result in a fast/busy dial tone. While we address this issue, please contact Little Rock Central High School National Historic Site at 501-516-7230.

title: Hazardous Conditions on Trails
description: Visitors should exercise caution when hiking areas of the park that have opened since Hurricane Helene. Hazards on trails and in forested areas such as hanging tree limbs, debris on the ground, and washed-out sections of trails and bridges are possible.

title: Flooding in Fort Massachusetts
description: Fort Massachusetts has been experiencing periodic flooding due to recent rain storms, causing park staff to close the fort for periods of time until the water recedes. Park staff will assess fort conditions daily and open the fort when conditions allow.

title: Skyline Drive Status
description: Click for more information.

title: Main Phone Line Out of Order
description: The Parks main phone line is currently out of service. The Visitor Center and Offices can be contacted at 432-426-3816 or 432-426-3094

title: Operating Hours
description: The seashore is currently operating on summer hours of 6:00 AM - 8:00 PM. Last entry into the seashore is at 7:00 pm.

title: U.S. Navy Blue Angels Practices
description: On Tuesdays and Wednesdays from April to October, parking lots at Fort Pickens Area fill early. Vehicles parked in non-designated spots are subject to citation and towing. When lots are full, the area will close to incoming traffic. Plan ahead.

title: Application for Special Use Permit
description: Each applicant will be required to complete a new "Application For Special Use Permit" prior to any new permit being issued

title: Closures Due to Flood Damage
description: Some areas of the park including Walnut Canyon Desert Drive and some trails remain closed after extensive flood damage. The main park road to the visitor center and cavern is open.

title: High Fire Danger
description: Due to high fire danger, there are multiple closures and prohibited activities. The main park road to Carlsbad Cavern and the visitor center is open.

title: Mica View Trail work
description: Resurfacing of Mica View Trail has been postponed due to material delays. This project is a high priority & we will resume work as soon as we are able. The trail will remain open as we wait, though surfacing work has already begun. Proceed with caution.

title: Vehicle Break-Ins
description: Saguaro National Park is an urban park. Vehicle break-ins have occurred at trailheads around the park. Don't make yourself a target. Leave valuables at home, secure your vehicle, and report any suspicious activity.

title: Folger Park Closed for Rehabilitation
description: The park is expected to reopen in winter 2025.

title: Visitor Center Closed
description: The Salt River Bay NHP&EP Visitor Contact station remains closed due to damage caused by Hurricanes Irma/Maria. Reconstruction of the Visitor Contact Station continues.

title: First Amendment Area
description: The primary designated First Amendment area is the grassy area directly Infront of the headquarters building at 81 Carl Sandburg Lane. This area is available for small groups of 25 or less on a “first come, first served” basis.

title: Feral Dogs May Be Seen in Organ Pipe Cactus National Monument
description: Feral dogs may be present at the Twin Peaks Campground and around the Kris Eggle Visitor Center. Visitors should not attempt to feed or water these dogs or approach them in any way as they may carry disease or become hostile.

title: No Hunting Allowed in Castle Mountains National Monument
description: Hunting is illegal in Castle Mountains National Monument

title: Most Monument Roads Require Heavy Duty 4WD Vehicle to Travel Safely
description: Breaking down in the remote monument can be a life-threatening emergency. Most roads require a well-equipped, heavy-duty 4WD vehicle to travel. 2WD high clearance vehicles must use Walking Box Ranch Rd for entry and exit. No Visitor Facilities Available.

title: Overseer's House and Dovecote Restrooms Temporarily Closed
description: Due to power outages related to building maintenance, the Overseer's House (Farmhouse) and the restrooms inside the dovecote are currently closed. The Quarters of the Enslaved, dairy and grounds are open. The mansion side of the park is unaffected.

title: Hozomeen Gate Remains Closed
description: Until further notice, the gate at Hozomeen will remain closed; vehicle and foot traffic across the US/Canada border is prohibited. Visitors must enter through a designated port of entry.

title: Washington Monument is closed for maintenance one day each month
description: Closures for 2025: Mon, Jan. 6, Thu., Jan. 9; Mon., Jan. 20; Thu., March 13; Wed., Apr. 16; Wed., May 14; Wed., June 4; Mon., July 14; Mon., Aug. 4; Mon., Sept. 15., Wed. Oct 8., Thurs. Nov 6., and Dec 11. The monument is also closed on July 4 and Dec 25.

title: Washington Monument and Old Post Office Tower closed one day each month for maintenance
description: Closures for 2025: Mon, Jan. 6, Thu., Jan. 9; Mon., Jan. 20; Thu., March 13; Wed., Apr. 16; Wed., May 14; Wed., June 4; Mon., July 14; Mon., Aug. 4; Mon., Sept. 15., Oct 8., Nov 6., and Dec 11. The monument is also closed on July 4 and Dec. 25.

title: List of trail closures post-Hurricane Helene
description: Many closures remain on the Trail following Hurricane Helene's devastation. This will remain true for the foreseeable future. Visit the Appalachian Trail Conservancy (ATC) website for an up-to-date list of closures. OBSERVE ALL CLOSURES. Stay safe!

title: Gas Pumps at Panamint Springs Resort are Closed at Night
description: Gasoline is available at Panamint Springs Resort from 7am-9:30pm, daily. Gas is available at Furnace Creek and Stovepipe Wells 24hrs.

title: Herbert Hoover NHS is Open. The Presidential Library and Museum is Closed for Renovations
description: The Herbert Hoover Presidential Library and Museum is closed to museum visitors with plans to reopen in 2026. The Research Room will remain open by appointment, and educational programming will continue during the renovation.

title: Prospectus for Passenger Ferry Service to the South Core Banks and Shackleford Banks and Land Transp
description: Find more information for concession business opportunity to provide passenger ferry service to the South Core Banks and Shackleford Banks and land transportation on the South Core Banks at https://www.nps.gov/subjects/concessions/cc-calo001-26.htm

title: Old Post Office Tower closed one day each month for maintenance
description: Closures for 2025: Mon, Jan. 6, Thu., Jan. 9; Mon., Jan. 20; Thu., March 13; Wed., Apr. 16; Wed., May 14; Wed., June 4; Mon., July 14; Mon., Aug. 4; Mon., Sept. 15. The monument is also closed on July 4 and Dec. 25.

title: Reception Center Rehabilitation Project
description: The Eisenhower Reception Center is undergoing a rehabilitation construction project in 2025. This will not impact visitors' ability to tour the Eisenhower home. For more, click here.

title: America the Beautiful Passes Temporary Unavailable
description: At this time all sales of America the Beautiful Passes are temporary unavailable. Please check https://store.usgs.gov/recreational-passes for locations. We will advise when passes are available for sale. We apologize for any inconvenience.

title: Trail closure for pipeline restoration project
description: The VC09/South Valle Toledo/Posos Trail from the Valle Toledo parking area to the eastern park boundary is closed for restoration. The NPS is working on a trail reroute for the 2025 season and will provide details as soon as possible.

title: Apertura retrasada hoy, 10 de enero debido a mal tiempo
description: Debido a condiciones del tiempo y riesgos elevados por la mañana, el parque abrirá en retraso a las 9 am el viernes, 10 de enero. Esperamos seguir las horas de atención regulares en el Centro Cultural, pero retrasos o cierres tempranos son posibles.

title: Delassus-Kern House and Grounds Closed
description: Due to hazardous conditions, the Delassus-Kern House and grounds are closed indefinitely.

title: Temporary change to park phone number
description: The park's phone number has temporarily changed. Please call 540-682-0173.

title: Municipal Pier Permanent Closure
description: Municipal Pier is closed permanently. After a safety review with the U.S. Public Health Service, it was determined that the deterioration of Municipal Pier in Aquatic Park Cove is unsafe for public use.

title: Parking Reservations Always Required - See "Know Before You Go" for Details
description: Reservations are required for all personal vehicles and shuttle riders at Muir Woods. You can make your reservation by visiting www.gomuirwoods.com. Visit our "Know Before You Go" webpage to learn more important details before your visit.

title: Important Visitor Information – Screening Process in Effect
description: This is a new national park within an active military installation, which includes the current home of the US Army War College. There are no visitor services at this time. Please check back in the spring of 2025 for updates.

title: Ongoing Closure Notices
description: Devils Island dock and campsites, West Bay Club on Sand Island, and the trail on Stockton Island between Presque Isle Bay and Quarry Bay are closed. These closures affect only a small portion of the Lakeshore. Enjoy your visit.

title: Beat the Heat
description: Make sure to take hot weather into consideration. Carry water and use sunscreen to reduce the risk of heat injuries during your visit.

title: Rip Currents and Rough Surf
description: Remember that rough surf is dangerous & rip currents can be deadly. Please use caution when swimming at Canaveral National Seashore.

title: Holiday Hours
description: On Thanksgiving Day, Christmas Eve, Christmas Day, and New Year's Day the visitor center will be closed (trails will remain open with access to restrooms on the north side of the building).

title: Cashless Fee Collection Exercise
description: Fort Davis National Historic Site to begin 6-month cashless fee collection exercise starting Monday November 18, 2024. Transition to electronic payments reduces transaction times, saves money, and improves accountability.

title: Please Email if Unable to Reach by Phone
description: Park phones are experiencing technical issues at this time. If unable to reach by phone, please feel free to email cong_information@nps.gov with any questions.

title: Part of Fort Totten Park remains closed for public safety
description: Out of an abundance of caution, Fort Totten Park will remain closed east of Fort Totten Drive, south of Gallatin Street/Metropolitan Branch Trail and north of Brookland Ave NE/Farragut St. due to the investigation involving two WWI-era munitions found.

title: Part of Fort Totten Park remains closed for public safety
description: Out of an abundance of caution, Fort Totten Park will remain closed east of Fort Totten Drive, south of Gallatin Street/Metropolitan Branch Trail and north of Brookland Ave NE/Farragut St. due to the investigation involving two WWI-era munitions found.

title: Rehabilitation of Colonial Parkway continues with additional Parkway closures
description: Beginning Tuesday, April 9, 2024, construction will close the Colonial Parkway to all travel in either direction between Yorktown and VA Route 199. Follow all detour signs. See additional closure information in the link below.

title: New Mexico Road Advisories
description: The New Mexico Department of Transportation updates its map of road advisories regularly. Visitors are encouraged to look for any possible road advisories along their route of travel beforehand.

title: Kirby Storter - Partial Reopen
description: As of 11/4/2024, the Kirby Storter Boardwalk will reopen to the public. Note that the boardwalk is only open part of the way, as rebuilding has not yet begun.

title: Baltimore Area Traffic Advisory
description: Traffic in the Baltimore area has increased considerably in recent months due to the collapse of the Francis Scott Key Bridge which connected the Baltimore beltway. Please check the latest traffic conditions to plan your travel accordingly.

title: Sat & Sun IF parking is full, entrance closes, no entrance until parking available.
description: Saturdays & Sundays with good weather, IF our parking lots fill we close the park entrance. (Georgetown Pike & Old Dominion Dr) We re-open when parking is available. No waiting, no street parking. Updates at Great Falls Park Facebook page.

title: Trail Conditions
description: Rain may cause trails to be slick and overgrown. Staff and Volunteer Trail Crews clear trails regularly. Visitors should use caution and report trail issues to viis_interpretation@nps.gov

title: Baltimore Area Traffic Advisory
description: Traffic in the Baltimore area has increased considerably in recent months due to the collapse of the Francis Scott Key Bridge which connected the Baltimore beltway. Please check the latest traffic conditions to plan your travel accordingly.

title: Moat Wall is closed for repairs until Fall 2026
description: The entire moat wall will be closed for repair and strengthening of the Fort Jefferson counterscarp (moat wall) damaged by Hurricane Irma in 2017 and Hurricane Ian in 2022. Additional damage occurred from hurricanes in 2024.

title: Wupatki Pueblo Partial Closure
description: 3 rooms at Wupatki pueblo are closed due to an unstable wall. The trail is fully open.

title: Temporary Number Change
description: The park's phone number has temporarily changed. Please call 434-694-8904.

title: Site Access
description: Be aware in your planning that I-40 in NC and I-26 in TN have been compromised due to the effects of Hurricane Helene. In addition, the Erwin Hwy (107) bridge leading into Greeneville was destroyed and is not expected to reopen until sometime in 2025.

title: Help Prevent Aquatic Invasive Species (AIS) Infestation
description: A number of lakes are infested with an array of aquatic invasive species that damage natural ecosystems and waterways. Boaters are advised to Clean, Drain, and Dry all boats and equipment every time they leave the water.

title: Visitor Phone Line Intermittent
description: You may experience problems reaching park staff via the main visitor phone line which functions intermittently. You may email the park at lavo_information@nps.gov with general park questions.

title: Maurice Stephens Parking Lot Closed During Construction Project
description: The parking lot near the Maurice Stephens house, located on Rt 23 opposite from the Washington Memorial Chapel, is closed during construction and renovation work on the house. Visitors are encouraged to park in the Chapel lot for Grand Parade trail access

title: Migrant Notice
description: Like elsewhere in the Florida Keys, we have seen an increase in Cuban migrants arriving by boat from Cuba and landing on the islands of Dry Tortugas National Park. You may observe migrant landings at the park and visitor areas may be impacted.

title: Expect Crowding
description: Parking lots and popular destinations are crowded especially on weekends and days with warm weather between 10 am and 3 pm.

title: Current East Rim Trail Status
description: Click "more" to find out if the East Rim trails are open today. In good conditions the trails are open 6 am-11 pm for bikers and as posted for other trail users. In wet or hazardous conditions, the trail will close to all users to prevent damage.

title: No Cell Service or WiFi
description: There is NO cell service or internet at Muir Woods. We discourage using a rideshare service to leave the woods. When hiring a taxi, visitors have the option of negotiating a flat rate or using the meter. Under some circumstances a flat rate may be cheaper

title: Black Bears Frequenting the McAfee Knob Area in Virginia
description: Human-habituated bears have been frequently spotted in the McAfee Knob Area. Allowing bears access to human food or garbage causes it to lose its fear of humans. Follow all food storage regulations, use provided food lockers and never feed a bear.

title: Boardwalks at Watch Hill Partially Closed
description: Due to storm damage, partial closure of boardwalks at Watch Hill Nature Trail are in effect.

title: Partial Closure of Rocky Springs Trail
description: The Rocky Springs section is closed from the Rocky Springs campground at milepost 55 to the northern terminus at milepost 59 until further notice. Visitors should observe posted closures. The trail is unsafe due to trail erosion and deteriorated bridges.

title: Lasting Effects from 2021 Dixie Fire
description: Some facilities, infrastructure, and areas remain closed; please adhere to all closure signs. In re-opened areas, hazards like fallen trees, loose/falling rock, undefined trails, and hidden stump holes exist. Click more to learn about burned area safety.

title: Natchez Visitor Center Closed
description: The Natchez Visitor Center is closed for the renovation of the public lobby area. For those seeking visitor information, we direct you to VisitNatchez at the Depot on Boundary Street. Or their website, VisitNatchez.org. We apologize for any inconvenience.

title: Closure: Portion of the Awatixa Trail
description: The river bank section of trail below the Sakakawea Village and continuing upriver to the parking access with is currently closed due to ongoing erosion and project work.

title: Backcountry Camping Closed
description: Backcountry camping at the park is closed. There is no established opening date at this time.

title: Use Caution in and around Pedersen Lagoon
description: On August 7, 2024, a landslide triggered tsunami washed over portions of Pedersen Lagoon near Aialik Bay (59.8842N, -149.7309W). We recommend caution for those visiting the area in and around Pedersen Lagoon. Click more for additional information.

title: Temporary Restrooms Open while Hospital Street Restroom Building is Closed
description: A temporary restroom trailer has been installed in the inner courtyard of the Guinea Company Warehouse. The public restrooms on Hospital Street are closed.

title: Government Wash closure to vehicle access and overnight camping
description: Government Wash Road and 8.0 Mile Road will be blocked, and motor vehicle access and overnight camping in the area will be prohibited. Hiking, biking, and shoreline access by boat for recreation within 100 feet of the shoreline will remain available.

title: Bartlett Park Restrooms Closed
description: The restrooms at Bartlett Park are closed until further notice due to damage from a large fallen tree.

title: Centennial Trailhead Parking
description: Reminder: Overnight parking without a camping permit is prohibited. Permits are not issued specifically for parking. Shuttles are available in the Black Hills for through hikers on the Centennial Trail.

title: Interdune Boardwalk Closed
description: Due to the active safety corridor, the Interdune Boardwalk is closed. Please visit the park visitor center to learn about other options during your visit.

title: Overlook Parking Lot Unavailable After Dark
description: The park parking lot at 72 McBride Extension is open from dawn to dusk every day. Any vehicles left in the parking lot after dusk (i.e. sunset) are subject to towing at owner's expense.

title: Major Rehabilitation on the North Parkway
description: The rehabilitation work on the North Parkway may result in impacts to travel. Click the link to sign up for updates on the project.

title: New Food Storage Guidelines to Reduce Human - Wildlife Interactions
description: In response to wolves accessing human food and garbage in and around Rock Harbor and campgrounds located on the east end of the island, new food storage guidelines to ensure the safety of visitors and wildlife are in effect.

title: Rehabilitation of Colonial Parkway continues with additional Parkway closures
description: Beginning Tuesday, April 9, 2024, construction will close the Colonial Parkway to all travel in either direction between Yorktown and VA Route 199. Follow all detour signs. See additional closure information in the link below.

title: Rehabilitation of Colonial Parkway continues with additional Parkway closures
description: Beginning Tuesday, April 9, 2024, construction will close the Colonial Parkway to all travel in either direction between Yorktown and VA Route 199. Follow all detour signs. See additional closure information in the link below.

title: Park Passes
description: Park passes, including: America the Beautiful, Veteran, Lifetime, etc., are UNAVAILABLE for purchase/pickup within Big Cypress. Shark Valley Visitor Center (Everglades) is the closest location to Big Cypress for purchase.

title: Bear Activity
description: Increased bear activity along the Namekagon river, ensure food and scented items are stored properly.

title: Canine distemper is believed to be present in the park.
description: Contact with saliva from wild animals can transmit distemper to pets, including from but not limited to water bowls, food bowls, trash etc. Distemper is not a threat to humans but can be deadly to pets. Ensure your pets are vaccinated or keep them home.

title: Hovenweep has gone cashless
description: The park now accepts only mobile or electronic payments for entrance & camping fees. You can reserve campsites and buy entrance passes on Recreation.gov, or only use debit/credit cards to pay in person.

title: Natural Bridges has gone cashless
description: The park now accepts only mobile or electronic payments for entrance & camping fees. You can reserve campsites and buy entrance passes on Recreation.gov, or only use debit/credit cards to pay in person.

title: Sick Birds and Wildlife, H5N1
description: Be cautious around sea lions, and dead or sick birds. If you get “bombed” by a bird, wash with soap and water immediately, monitor for signs of illness, and call your doctor. Report beached, sick or distressed wildlife to Wildlife Mortality Reporting.

title: Bear Alert
description: Black bears inhabit many of the Apostle Islands. Follow safety guidelines: store food and scented items properly, hike in groups, stay attentive, and make noises if you encounter a bear in a visitor area.

title: Partial Closures of Calumet Bike Trail
description: Due to recent re-construction efforts, partial closures of the Calumet Bike Trail will be in effect through this fall and sometime next year. Please use caution if riding on the trail (see below) and off the trail (because of the closures).

title: Federal Public Lands Closed to All Sheep Hunting in Portions of Units 20E/25C for 2024/2025 Seasons
description: The Federal Subsistence Board issued a closure to all hunting of sheep on lands south of the Yukon River within Yukon-Charley Rivers National Preserve due to a major decline in sheep abundance.

title: Private Inholdings: Sand & Rocky Islands
description: There are privately occupied residences and docks on the southeast corner of Sand Island, as well as just north of Group Site A on Rocky Island. These areas are closed to the public. Please respect their privacy and do not trespass in these locations.

title: Overlook Park Parking Lot - Vehicles Must Be Parked in a Designated Spot
description: Parking is extremely limited on weekends & event days. Overflow parking is available at the Paterson Museum, located at 2 Market Street. On weekends only, additional parking is available at the lot across from the Museum.

title: Mansion ADA Lift is currently not functional awaiting a replacement
description: Mansion ADA Lift is currently not functional awaiting a replacement, physical accessibility to the mansion will be limited to those with the ability to climb 3-4 steps into the first floor. We apologize for any inconvenience.

title: Jacob Riis Park Access Restrictions
description: Due to extremely hazardous conditions Gateway National Recreation Area has restricted access to sections of Jacob Riis Park. Erosion has created unsafe conditions from Bays 1-5, and portions of the eastern beach are closed.

title: Wupatki VC Phone Outages
description: The main phone line for the visitor center experiences occasional outages. Please email FLAG_Information@nps.gov if you have trouble getting through on the main number.

title: Trail and Parking Area Re-Opened - Mt. Alava Trail
description: Mt. Alava trail and parking area are now open to the public. Access to the summit from the Alava Trailhead is strictly prohibited due to serious risks. Death or serious injury can occur. Mt. Alava summit remains accessible from the Old Vatia trail.

title: Items Worn or Used in Other Caves Not Allowed
description: A disease known as White-Nose Syndrome is killing bats in North America. To prevent it from spreading to our bats, do not wear shoes, clothing, or bring any gear into any cave at Carlsbad Caverns National Park that were in another cave.

title: Timed Entry Ticket Required to Enter Carlsbad Cavern
description: Reservations are highly recommended and can be purchased by clicking "more" or calling 877-444-6777. Reservations only select the entry time. Upon arrival at the visitor center, an entrance pass must be purchased.

title: Hiking in Gold Mine Tract
